summary: Experienced Senior Researcher with a demonstrated history of working in the semiconductors industry. Strong research professional with a PhD in Nanomaterials and Nanotechnology. Skilled material scientist with  experience in thin film deposition and characterization, processing  and physics of semiconductor materials.

profile_positions.description: As Senior Application Engineer, I play a key role in the new product introduction, ensuring the delivery of applications and systems that satisfy customer requirements. I support  sustaining escalations both technically and by coordinating/managing a smooth communication between the D&E experts in Veldhoven and the engineers in the fields.
profile_positions.title: Senior Customer Support Engineer

profile_positions.description: As material expert, with extensive knowledge in deposition processes (LPCVD, PVD, Sputtering) and characterization techniques (FTIR, VASE, XPS, SEM/EDX, AFM) of ultra- thin films, contributing to the development of the EUV pellicle product
profile_positions.title: Senior Design engineer _ EUV Pellicle

company.name: Max Planck Institute for Polymer Research

profile_positions.company: Max Planck Institute for Polymer Research
profile_positions.title: Post-doctoral Researcher

profile_positions.location: Zernike Institute for Advanced Materials, Groningen
profile_positions.description: My research focused on characterization and application of organic materials, functional nanoparticles and hybrid systems for opto-electronic devices. I highly contributed to the optimization of the nanocrystal processing and the elucidation of the device physics of high performance nanocrystal devices. Managing of the device fabrication laboratory, tutoring and training of students.
profile_positions.title: Post-doctoral researcher

profile_positions.location: Prof. Fréchet Group, University of California, Berkeley
profile_positions.description: During my Post-doc in Prof.Fréchet group  my primary interest and experience has been the study of the relationship between the structure and the characteristics of organic materials and their electronic properties. By collecting and analyzing device data from a large library of compounds, which I contributed to design, I was able to elucidate some of the key requirements for high performing photovoltaic materials. I have actively participated to the setting up of a new device fabrication laboratory, in diverse roles from organizing the work and protocols to calibrating the instruments.
profile_positions.title: Post-doctoral researcher
